meanings.definition: A mass of small bubbles formed on or in liquid, typically by agitation or fermentation.
meanings.sent1: The foam on top of the soda looked so bubbly.
meanings.sent2: She scooped up some foam from the bathwater.
meanings.sent3: The foam from the washing machine made a funny shape on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The foam of excitement bubbled up inside her.
meanings.sent5: The foam in the glass sparkled like tiny diamonds.

meanings.definition: A similar mass formed from saliva or sweat.
meanings.sent1: The foam at the corner of his mouth was noticeable.
meanings.sent2: After the run, sweat foam gathered on his forehead.
meanings.sent3: The foam from his sweat made a silly pattern on his shirt.
meanings.sent4: The foam of exertion covered his body.
meanings.sent5: The foam of sweat glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A substance used to produce a frothy mass.
meanings.sent1: She poured the soap to create foam for the bubble bath.
meanings.sent2: The chef added the foam to the dessert for a fancy touch.
meanings.sent3: The foam from the soap dispenser sprayed everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The foam of the latte art was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The foam of the shaving cream smelled like mint.
